thread.title: Multiple Republican Senators Defy Trump, Refuse to Vote for Betsy DeVos as Education Secy
thread.title_full: Multiple Republican Senators Defy Trump, Refuse to Vote for Betsy DeVos as Education Secy

author: John S. Roberts
title: Multiple Republican Senators Defy Trump, Refuse to Vote for Betsy DeVos as Education Secy
text:
Guess what? 
Republican ‘Never Trumpers’ still exist. 
Even after the 45th president has more than proven himself to be a reliable conservative since taking office, some “conservatives” in Congress are still going against his cabinet nominations. 
Two Republican senators, Lisa Murkowski (Alaska) and Susan Collins (Maine), have decided they will vote ‘no’ on Trump’s pick for secretary of education, Betsy DeVos. 
Both ‘no’ votes put DeVos’ confirmation in jeopardy. 
Republican Sens. Susan Collins (Maine) and Lisa Murkowski (Alaska) have indicated that they will vote oppose DeVos’ confirmation. 
Without the support of the two Republicans, the likelihood of DeVos’ confirmation becomes questionable. 
According to the Washington Post , both senators have said they admire DeVos’s efforts to help at-risk children through her advocacy for school vouchers and charter schools, they are feel she doesn’t have the experience to lead the Department of Education because she has not worked in public schools, attended them or sent her children to them. 
“I simply cannot support her confirmation,” Collins said during remarks on the Senate floor. 
… 
“I take very personally the success of Alaska’s schools and Alaska schoolchildren,” Murkowski said. “I believe that my colleagues here in the United States Senate and the many, many that they represent have the right to debate these questions.” 
Apparently, Collina and Murkowski didn’t get the message on November 8th. 
The people chose Donald Trump. 
They trust his vision for the future of the nation. 
Time to get onboard, ladies. LIKE this article?
